trustfund: TF024077-BNPP-HEALTH: OTHER HNP - REGIONAL,TF025082-PHRD-HEALTH SECTOR SUPPORT PROJECT,TF036983-LESOTHO - HEALTH INVESTMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Lesotho Health Sector Reform Project
            had a satisfactory outcome, likely sustainability, modest
            institutional development impact, and  satisfactory overall
            Bank and Borrower performance is satisfactory. Theses
            lessons were cited: (1) Sustained commitment to reforms and
            coordination with other ministries is important. (2) Broad
            ownership of the reform process is key for reform program
            success. (3) Budgeting priorities must be consistent with
            financial planning. (4) The health sector is human resource
            intensive and requires decentralization to effectively
            deliver health care services. (5) Balance improvements in
            health sector processes with a focus on improving health
            services delivery. (6) A multi-sectoral response to HIV/AIDS
            requires well-coordinated and efficient implementation
            mechanisms. (7) Pay attention to monitoring and evaluation
            at the beginning of a project. (8) Further strengthen donor
            coordination for continued success of the health sector
            reform program.
